fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40833].
  {panel}

Currently a mailhandler tries to find the ticket in the summary of an email.

We have several mail handlers and had the problem that somebody forwarded a jira notification to a mail handler mail account. The mailhandler recognized the ticket and added a comment to the found ticket.

The expected behaviour was that a ticket was created in the default project.
But this shall not happen for all mails, sometimes (within the default project) a comment shall indeed be added to the ticket.

So we suggest an option in the mail handler config to select "Handler only for default project". If the ticket reference in the summary is found within the default project, a comment is added. If not, a new ticket is created, even if the named ticket exists already in Jira in a different project.
fields.summary: option for incoming mail handler to only create tickets in default project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40832].
  {panel}

Currently behaviour:
Send a mail containing two screenshots (not attachments but images inserted into the mail text(html)). Jira mailhandler inserted them into the ticket as attachments, both named "IMAGE.PNG". In the ticket description, there is text "1" and "2" where the images where.

Suggestion 1:
- each image the mailhandler attaches should get a unique name so it can be easily embedded in the description

Suggestion 2:
- instead of "1" and "2", the mailhandler should insert the "!imagename.png|thumbnail!" directive which leads to a thumbnail of the attached image
fields.summary: Unique names for attachments (images) attached by incoming mail handler

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40831].
  {panel}

It would be nice to get a confirmation of a creation of a ticket by a mail handler. Currently this can only be reached by setting the value of "Notify own changes" to True.
As a company that works much with Jira this is no option as many people would spam theirselfes.
So nearly everybode has set this option to False.

This results in writing an email to an account with configured mail handler and getting no notification. So nobody knows that a jira ticket was created until some action takes place in the ticket. And even if one knows that a Jira Ticket is created, one doesn't know the ticket ID for an additional info or question.

The suggestion is to make an additional checkbox for configuring the mail handler with name "Notify Reporter on Creation" with the meaning of new tickets that are created will trigger a notification to the reporter no matter what setting "Notify own changes" is made.
fields.summary: confirming notification of ticket creation by incoming mail handler

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40829].
  {panel}

Hey

How about a way to create custom avatars based on a set of faces, hairstyles, etc. like on the Nintendo Wii to provide more different avatars out of the box.

Maybe this is something you guys can develop during a ShipIt Day :)

Cheers

fields.summary: JIRA - Getting HTTP 500 Error When Retrieving any JIRA
Deleting an Issue should Warn Users that the Work Logged will also be Removed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40815].
  {panel}

Hello,

I'd like to outline the workflow I use for upgrading JIRA on Windows and the frustrations I have with it for hopeful improvement.  I'm running the x64 installer on Windows Server 2012 R2.

1) Registration settings get removed during every upgrade yet Confluence persists them.  I have to set manual min and max memory and add a plug-in delay line to the java options.  I have to do this with every single JIRA upgrade but again, not with Confluence, it persists my values

2) You have a checkbox at the end of the JIRA install "Launch JIRA" which is not checked but the service IS started.  I don't want the service to start automatically when the JIRA update is complete as I have to go into the registry to and set the values again and also copy in my custom config file with my server alias, url, port, etc. 

3) If you detect a custom config file move it to a temp location, do the install, then rename the original .new and put my config file back in place so I don't have to do it every time.

With a little effort the upgrade process can be more seamless.  Leave the registry settings intact, don't start the service if I don't have the "Launch JIRA" checkbox checked on the last install wizard screen, and keep my customizations by putting them back after upgrade.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Post installation feedback and improvements

fields.description:
I'm using JIRA REST API, and I want to create an Issue (POST request). If I provide Assignee, Reporter or DueDate for it, it returns me a 'Bad Request'.
Although if I create the Issue without them, I can later set it by PUT request (no error occurs).
fields.summary: Bad request on creating Issue with Assignee or Reporter or DueDate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40812].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create new filter with name: *AA_1.6_Unresolved*
2. In existing dashboard, pick a gadget and try to change the filter to *AA_1.6_Unresolved*
3. typing in *AA_1.6* yields nothing. Nor does *1.6_Unresolved*. In fact, no matter what combination you try, you won't be able to select *AA_1.6_Unresolved* from the drop down menu. 

Customer Feedback: 
{quote}
Please reinstate the ability to select the filter in dashboard gadgets via a pop-up window! Recent updates made it impossible for me to select new filters, so I'm totally stuck right now!
{quote}

There are two issues in play:
#  Multiple filters that contain the name *Unresolved* doesn't show all available filters in autocomplete. 
# If a filter contains a dash followed by a number it won't be available in autocomplete. For example, the following filter name will cause an issue: {code}Filter-6{code} but {code}Filter - 6{code} and/or {code}Filter-Six{code} are perfectly fine. 

Ideally we can manually escape the characters as a workaround until this is fully resolved.
fields.summary: Cannot select filter in gadget
Increase Filter name length in the Issue navigator screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40810].
  {panel}

Sometimes, there are add-on modules that are disabled :

!module1.png|thumbnail!

Usually, they can be enabled by the user, and then be used without any problems. However, there are times when the module cannot be enabled, and says that it cannot be modified :

!module2.png|thumbnail!

The message does nothing to explain to the user why it cannot be modified. This causes confusion and frustration, especially when trying to figure out what is causing the module to be disabled.

It would be much better if there could be a helptip that explains why the module cannot be modified (for example, it it's a critical tool that affects JIRA functionality, or if it's not compatible with the current JIRA version, etc).
fields.summary: Have better explanations for add-on modules that cannot be modified
As a user, I would like to use JQL in gadgets directly, rather than via a saved filter.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40807].
  {panel}

The version management page is just a basic table and does not allow the user to handle hundreds or thousands of versions conveniently.

JVQL (Jira Version Query Language) would be the best solution. ;)

Failing that, basic column filtering as in Excel would really help.

The user should also be able to select a paged view. In that case, there needs to be a different way to reorder versions than by dragging (e.g. a "move before/after version" dialog).
fields.summary: As a project admin, I want to manage large numbers of versions.
Workflow designer: ability to hide transitions from the "View (Read-Only) Workflow" diagram
Offer Jira (and othere Atlassian products) as Synology Packages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40803].
  {panel}

When using the pie chart gadget, you have to click on the pie chart itself to go to the specific query for that slice.
With a crowded pie chart it's sometimes difficult to trace the line from the label to the correct slice.
We also have one pie chart that shows the issues in a long-running project. It currently has 5 slices: Closed (1118), Resolved (19), Open (5), In Progress (4), Reviewing (1). As you can imagine, clicking on the Reviewing slice is quite challenging (it is in fact impossible with the standard display settings that we use)

I think it would make sense to also make the labels clickable, not just the pie slices.
fields.summary: Make legend clickable in pie chart gadget
Make it easy to change issue types

Versions: Unreleased

fields.summary: Sort versions on the summary page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40797].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
* Add the "Assign the issue to the lead developer" post function to a project. Basically this function assigns the ticket to the component lead. In this test, I added the post function to Resolve issue transition. 
* Create two components for a project
* Assign different users for the Component Lead
!component_1.jpg|thumbnail!
* Create an issue and associate it to both components
!component_2.jpg|thumbnail!
* Resolve the issue and see who will be the Assignee of the ticket.
!component_3.jpg|thumbnail!
!component_4.jpg|thumbnail!

h6. Additional Information:
* Regardless of the order of the component that you select (eg, you selected banana first and then apple), it always picks up the Component Lead of Apple.
* I also have tested to interchange the Component Lead for banana and apple (apple-danny, banana-admin), but once you resolved the ticket, it will be assigned to user "danny" who is the component lead for apple. Somehow, it only picks up the component alphabetically. 
* When there is no component lead for apple and user "danny" is the component lead for banana, it automatically assigns the issue to the project lead upon resolving the ticket. Again, the second component has been disregarded.
fields.summary: Component field only picking up the first Component specified in a Project and Ignoring the next one
Ability to Choose the Lead Developer for "Assign the issue to the lead developer" Post Function

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40795].
  {panel}

When the Resolution field is hidden for a project, the "Recently Created Issue Report" is showing the correct details. However, when you check it from the issue navigator, it shows no issue. You will wonder where the chart is getting it's data as the issue navigator is showing no issues. it is confusing for the users if the data being shown are not in sync. 

h6. Steps to reproduce:
* Hide the Resolution field for a specific project.
* Generate a "Recently Created Issues Report". it will show you how many issues are unresolved/resolved vs created when you hover the mouse on the graph.
* Click on the graph and it will direct you to the issue navigator

h6. Expected Behavior:
The graph should show no resolved issues as the field resolution is hidden. Issue navigator is behaving as expected.

h6. Actual Behavior:
When you hover the mouse on the graph, it shows certain number of issues but when you click on the graph, it will direct you to the issue navigator which shows no issue (as the Resolution field is hidden). 
!bug_1.jpg|thumbnail!
!bug_2.jpg|thumbnail!

Additional Information:
* The above use case *only* happens when the Resolution field is hidden. issue navigator and Report are giving correct data if the resolution field is present.
fields.summary: Recently Created Issues Report vs Issue navigator if the Resolution Field is Hidden

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40789].
  {panel}

Hello, 

Some feedback was recieved recently on the Worked Time Chart Gadget:

-We did 2 charts on our dashboard : one for a 2 weeks span and one for a 8 weeks span. However, the Gadget doesn’t display the time span information so it’s hard to distinguish between the two gadgets (unless we check the configuration of the gadget or guess that the highest total time corresponds to the 8 week span gadget)
-If we click on “Details” we get only the information for the last week (5Nov to 11 Nov) by default, even though we selected a larger span in the gadget options (e.g. 2 week or 8 weeks span). 
-When choosing a 3 weeks span, the graph doesn’t render (see second image below)
-In Chrome, with 100% Zoom, the chart displays with scrolling bars at the bottom instead of adjusting to the desired zoom level. (With a dashboard layout of 3 columns) 

Thank you very much,
fields.summary: Worked Time Chart Improvements

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40787].
  {panel}

Currently, even if a user is not logged into JIRA, he/she will still be able to access the _Issue Navigator_ using the URL: http://<JIRA_URL>/issues/?jql=/.

h3.Steps to reproduce:
# Setup a JIRA instance.
# Try to go to the _Issue Navigator_ URL (for example: http://localhost:8080/issue/?jql=)
# Even if you are not logged in, you will still be able to see the issue navigator.

There are customers who share their filters with everyone, and having the Issue Navigator URL publicly accessible allows for any user to browse those filters and see the filter owner name, for instance.

Although this is the expected behaviour, it would be helpful to have the possibility of restricting access to the Issue Navigator (e.g. in the General Settings) so that anonymous users are redirected to a login page.
fields.summary: It should be possible to restrict access to the Issue Navigator by anonymous users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40782].
  {panel}

The way custom field description hierarchy is handled within JIRA seems to be counter-intuitive to some of our customers.
Examples below:
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/62727/jira-v5-strange-custom-field-behavior
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/47433/how-to-update-custom-field-description
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/61711/custom-field-description-not-displayed
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/13046/custom-field-descriptions-not-displaying-correctly

Perhaps we can find a way to clarify the hierarchy with the field configuration to customers that are editing on creating a description to a custom field.

Our documentation states:
{quote} 
Changing the description of a custom field

Not changing the description in a field configuration means that any changes you make to a custom field's description are not seen.

JIRA allows you to define a description of a custom field, and if the field configuration descriptions are left empty then the original description text will appear when you create or edit an issue, and as help text in the Issue Navigator. However you can also define different description texts in each field configuration and this will override the original field description text.

For example if a custom field "My Field" is defined with a description of "This is my field" and no field configuration changes are made, then the displayed text will be "This is my field" as expected. If field configurations are used and a description "This is my excellent field" is set for the custom field in the field description, then the displayed text will be "This is my excellent field". 
{quote}
fields.summary: Editing a Custom Field description does not update due to being overwritten by the Field Configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40768].
  {panel}

Most email clients add a 'In-Reply-To: <messageid>' header, when replying to a message. This allows the client to keep track of mail threads. It would be nice if JIRA added this header to email notifications, so that all mails relating to a certain issue would be grouped in a thread. In established projects, 80% of the traffic is bug reports and updates, and such a feature would make a big difference.

----

This is a duplicate of JRA-1113 from 2003, which was closed because it was "incorporated" into JRA-2326, which had no changes since 2009.

This is request is a simple feature. There is no need to wait for a super huge email integration issue just to get better mail handling.
fields.summary: Add threading to notification emails

h3. Current behaviour

Fields like Project, Issue and Priority cannot have their rendered modified (as some users do not want the autocomplete renderer to be used because of accessibility issues).

h3. Expected behaviour

Allow the user to change the renderer of fields that don't show up in the field configuration screen.
This severely affects accessibility tools such as Screen readers like JAWS, which cannot be used agains auto-complete fields.

In [Tuning Database Connections|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Tuning+Database+Connections#TuningDatabaseConnections-settings] the "recommendation" column states "This value should always be 'false' as JIRA borrows a connection for each database operation."

Cheers,

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40754].
  {panel}

In [Tuning Database Connections|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Tuning+Database+Connections#TuningDatabaseConnections-settings] it states "If you specify a Validation Query above, then you should specify a value for the Validation Query Timeout too."

However, in [Surviving Connection Closures|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Surviving+Connection+Closures] it says "(!) This should only be done for MySQL" and "(!) If the Validation Query Timeout is used on any database other than MySQL it will cause significant problems with the JIRA instance."

Which is truthier?  The other should be updated to match.

Cheers,
Morg.
fields.summary: Information regarding use of validation-query-timeout is not consistent.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40751].
  {panel}

Hi,
              The problem is that as admins we can't control user's sharing choices, if they choose to share a filter to Everyone, anonymous users can see filter names, even with Jira running in Private mode. Many filter names contains user names and / or confidential data on them, this is a critical  security issue/bug.

There should be an option to disable 'All users' as a possible sharing option, limiting it to Group or Project, or adding another choice, like  'Logged in users') instead of 'All users'.

Thanks in advance,
fields.summary: Disable 'All users' as a possible sharing option for filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40738].
  {panel}

h3. Issue Summary

You can restrict the scope of custom field so they aren't available in all issues. You can do that per issue type, for example:
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-21 at 11.36.30.png|thumbnail! 

But, currently, the *Basic search* cannot perform searches using the restricted field as criteria even though the search matches with the scope that field is restricted to:
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-21 at 11.37.06.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-01-21 at 11.37.43.png|thumbnail! 

In that case, although I had selected the correct issue type the field was restricted to, I couldn't get its options. I was able to perform an advanced search and select the value, but when switching back, the value was not supported.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Restrict the scope of a custom field to a specific issue type;
* Try to perform a basic search, using it as criteria along with the correct issue type.


h3. Expected Results

You should be able to to select that field's options.

h3. Actual Results

You cannot perform a basic search using the restricted field even though the criteria matches with its scope.

h3. Workaround

Use [advanced search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-764478330.html] instead.
fields.summary: Cannot perform basic search towards a field with restricted scope even though the search criteria matches its scope

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40736].
  {panel}

We had to add some technical jira-Accounts to optimize dispatching workflows and our controlling dashboards.

These accounts are team users, which are only used to assign jiras to a team. (Users email-adress is a mailing list, team account or team leaders account.)

We can't dispatch jiras by projects and assignee is a mandatory field due to other rules in our workflow.

Can you please add the possibility to add users, which can't login to Jira and exclude these account from the list of users under license control.

With this option you can easily build team queues and canban like dashboards.

Regards,
  Petra Pensky
fields.summary: add technical users, which are not under license control

Extending [JRA-22417|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-22417], if an user in JIRA does not receive notifications for an Issue Updated Event but does for Issue Commented, if there's any comments added during the update JIRA should send the notification for Issue Commented. 

h4. Example:
UserA isn't a recipient of the *Issue Updated* event, but is of the *Issue Commented.
\\
* *Current Behavior:* If a comment is added when editing an issue, UserA will not receive any notifications (neither from the Updated Fields nor the Comment).

* *Desired Behavior:* If a comment is added when editing an issue, UserA would receive a 'Comment Added' notification.
fields.summary: Send Issue Commented notification if notification is not sent for Issue Updated

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40715].
  {panel}

*Description*
Administrators should have the ability to modify what a user will see when they select a project.

As it stands, even if a user is assigned only one issue in a Project, they can still see the Summary, Issues, Calendar, Components, Labels and Agile tabs on the Project's Dashboard. They can also see Reports and all activity associated with the Project.

This feature would allow the administrator to only allow them to view single Issues, rather than the other information associated with that Project.

h5. Expected Behaviour

When bulk moving issues within the same project, the "Affects Version" (required) field will let you set a value to it, allowing the operation to effectively complete.

h5. Actual Behaviour

When bulk moving issues within the same project, the "Affects Version" (required) field will be checked in as Retained and the user will not be able to set anything for the field - not allowing the Bulk to complete.

When moving the issue directly (not using the bulk) the page let's you set the required field.

In a url like this:
https://<my.jira.url>/browse/<projectkey>/fixforversion/<versionid>/?selectedTab=com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:version-summary-panel


I believe this is part of the version-summary-panel module, part of the JIRA Projects Plugin (com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin). 

I would like to be able to configure this view so we can raise or lower the number of issues which appear without needing to drill in further.  People are reaching this page via team calendars (after drilling into a version, which is bound to a date on the calendar) and don't find the data presented on the landing page particularly useful because it is limited to showing only the 3 most recent entries.

It would be ideal if the project admin could configure how many issues are shown on these pages up to a maximum defined by the JIRA system admin

Working with epics in agile boards' PLAN mode allows to quickly recognize any tickets corresponding to a certain epic. Vice versa on the left hand side an epic can be selected to focus on only those stories which belong to exactly that epic.

This is all fine.

But if there are more epics in the list than can be displayed on the screen it will become cubersome to select an epic because one needs to scroll down and find it.

Feature wish: It would be great if I could select the epic by simply clicking on it's little sticker in the ticket's row. The GUI could display the selected epic at a prominent place on the screen and by clicking a little "x" next to it the epic would be unselected.

(This idea could also be extended to work for versions or assignees as well.)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40675].
  {panel}

With the new [CSV Importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+issues+using+the+CSV+importer] feature, non-admins can now create issues via CSV importing. However, users are only able to map fields defined in the *Create Issue* screen. Some circumstances require users to map to fields not present in the *Create Issue* screen. These are example situations
* Let's say that I have multiple PRs to be treated and whose correction is given to a subcontractor for development.
Subcontractor does not have access to JIRA but I need to gather informations that were changed by the development team. Changes can be field modifications not present on "Create Issue" screen or status changes
When starting development, project leader gives a csv export to the subcontractor, which in return gives a modified csv file that needs to be imported into JIRA by project leader.

* Let's say that we have a validation team, which cannot access to JIRA because they are working on the field or outside our premises. They may need to add comments, modify fields not present on "Create Issue" screen and even change status in a csv file that the project leader could import into JIRA

Under these circumstances, it would be useful if the CSV Importer have the ability to map to fields which are not defined in the *Create Issue* screen
fields.summary: Ability to map to more fields when creating issues using the CSV importer

Hi guys.

It would be really nice if a JIRA incoming mail handler could be disabled, rather than having to be deleted to stop it processing.

Scenarios where this would be extremely useful. ie.  disabled until the issue resolved.
* User managed mailbox which contains items that cannot be processed, therefore generating ongoing errors.

* User managed mailbox which has an authentication issue. 

* Any maintenance of a mailbox or changes to the folder structure etc.

Thanks
Mark.
fields.summary: The ability to disable mail handlers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40669].
  {panel}

*Use Case* 
A search/report has multiple criteria in the report/filter (_Project_, _fixVersion_, and _Assignee_ for example). This feature would allow _Project_ and _fixVersion_ to remain protected by the filter creator, while _Assignee_ would be modified by the user before running the search.

This would allow administrators to create a single search filter that would apply in multiple cases without needing their users to understand JQL, and preventing their filters from being modified without their knowing/consent.

This could also be accomplished by generating a prompt in the interface when the user clicks on the search filter/report to input the modifiable criteria.
fields.summary: Issue Filters with Protected Criteria

Hi there,
I'm a fairly new admin with pretty much the full set of atlassian products: jira, bamboo, confluence and fisheye.
The problem is I am yet to be successful at integrating them all together, going hurdle after hurdle.

A good first step would be to streamline the Application Link creation between those products without having to guess all the inputs.
I understand when creating those links to other application they could be necessary, but when creating the application links between the atlassian products, why do you need us to guess the values for IP patterns, URL patterns, authentications incoming and outgoing? Those are all your products, you cannot fill all of that for us instead of making us guess and go through your confluence pages (like this broken one for example from the latest version of JIRA https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE035/Configuring+Trusted+Applications+Authentication+for+an+Application+Link) to find list of URL patterns that are not even consistent.
Why does it take more than 1 click to link 2 atlassian products?

So, please, can you auto-fill all the answers for application links when linking atlassian products with each other? (or even don't even show them)

thanks
fields.summary: Can you make JIRA looking like well integrated with Confluence, Bamboo and Fisheye

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40647].
  {panel}

This is related to JRA-33941 and may be JRA-29032

As plugin vendor I've got several customer complains that gadget is not rendered properly on Internet Explorer 9 (IE9). See [Issue#559|https://bitbucket.org/azhdanov/jiratimesheet/issue/559/timesheet-gadget-displays-data-incorrectly] for example.

It's clearly reproducible, but I'm trying hard to find anything I can do in plugin with no luck.

I hope there is something that can be done in JIRA gadget container.

E.g. /plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr servlet can provide X-UA compatibility meta in html head.

It may be that JRA-29032 has caused such regression, by removing chrome=1 from X-UA Compatibility meta.

Note, JIRA standard gadgets are not using iframes any more, so there is no such problem there, but plugin gadgets are in iframe, so I suspect they may need own X-UA compatibility meta, that can not be provided by gadget itself, but may be provided by JIRA instead.

Is it something that Atlassian can look at, please?

Thank you.
fields.summary: X-UA Compatibility Meta Tag in JIRA 6 plugin gadget
